docs.title: Introduction
docs.text:
NETTV Dashboard is a web application developed by WorldLink's in-house programming team to facilitate WorldLink staff in managing and troubleshooting IPTV-related services for WorldLink's retail customers. Since there wasn't dedicated software to process NETTV customer information (some functionalities existed in Ebill), NETTV Dashboard was built to handle daily tasks.

Note

The NETTV Dashboard is designed specifically for Retail customers, offering features and functionalities tailored to their needs. Corporate NETTV customers, with their unique requirements, are supported directly by our dedicated Corporate department, ensuring they receive the most relevant assistance and solutions.

docs.title: What is an IPTV?
docs.text: IPTV stands for Internet Protocol Television. It's a service that delivers digital content over the internet. IPTV allows users to stream television channels and consume other digital contents over an internet connection, unlike traditional cable or satellite services.

docs.title: What is NETTV?
docs.text:
NETTV is an IPTV service offered by WorldLink and partnered ISPs to their customers, in conjunction with their FTTH Internet Service. It utilizes Internet Protocol Television (IPTV) technology to deliver a comprehensive range of multimedia services to clients via a set-top box (STB), providing access to diverse digital content and features directly on their televisions.

Distribution facilitated through local ISPs guarantees high-quality streaming while minimizing user internet traffic. This dedicated cloud infrastructure prioritizes quality, promising a seamless and uninterrupted full HD viewing experience.

NETTV, operated by NITV STREAMZ PVT LTD and based in Jawalakhel, Lalitpur, stands as Nepal's first licensed OTT/IPTV platform, pioneering multimedia service delivery through internet protocols. Leveraging industry leaders' expertise in streaming and multi-screen solutions, NETTV ensures an enriched viewing experience.

docs.title: NETTV Features
docs.text:
Live TV: Watch a wide range of local and international live TV channels, including news, sports, entertainment, and more.

On-demand content: Access a vast library of movies, TV shows, documentaries, and other on-demand content. You can even subscribe to popular streaming services like Amazon Prime Video etc. directly through NETTV.

Apps and games: Download and install various apps and games from the Google Play Store. This includes popular apps like YouTube, Facebook, Twitter, and many more.

4K HDR support: Enjoy stunning picture quality with 4K HDR content.

Chromecast built-in: Easily cast your smartphone or tablet screen to your TV using Chromecast.

Google Assistant: Use your voice to control your TV and access information hands-free.

Bluetooth connectivity: Connect your wireless headphones or speakers for a more immersive experience.

Dual-band Wi-Fi: Enjoy fast and reliable internet connectivity with dual-band Wi-Fi.

Smart Phone as Remote: Use your smartphone as a remote control for NETTV.

docs.title: Add Refer Bonus
docs.text:
This functionality is used when one customer refers WorldLink's Internet package to another customer but due to some issues the NETTV account doesnt synchronize with the bonus Internet days which they earned as a part of "Refer Offer".

Note

Refer bonus adds Internet days to both the referer and the referee. The amount of days added to the referer's account depends upon the amount of people being referred.

docs.title: Case I: Referred account not getting the bonus
docs.text:
If the referred account didn't get the NETTV Refer bonus then follow these steps:

  1. Enter the Customer's username (Referred account in this case) in the USERNAME field and select the respective username from the suggestions.
  2. Choose a respective MAC Address from STB dropdown field.
  3. Related information such as STB TYPE and MAPPING will be loaded after selecting the desired MAC Address. (Make sure the Is Referer checkbox is not checked)
  4. Enter the amount of bonus days that needs to get added in the Days field.
  5. Enter remarks in the Remarks field.
  6. Click the ADD button.

docs.title: Case II: Both Referer and Referred account not getting the bonus
docs.text:
If both the referer and referred account didn't get the NETTV Refer bonus then follow these steps:

  1. Enter the Customer's username (This will be the referer account in this case) in the USERNAME field and select the respective username from the suggestions.
  2. Choose a respective MAC Address from STB dropdown field.
  3. Related information such as STB TYPE and MAPPING will be loaded after selecting the desired MAC Address.
  4. Check the Is Referer checkbox.
  5. Enter the Referred Username in the Referred Username field.
  6. Enter the amount of bonus days that needs to get added in the Days field.
  7. Enter remarks in the Remarks field.
  8. Click the ADD button.

docs.title: Extend Account
docs.text:
As the name suggest, this functionality extends the NETTV account date of the customer.

To extend account of a customer:

  1. Enter the Customer's username in the USERNAME field and select the respective username from the suggestions.
  2. Choose a respective MAC Address from STB dropdown field.
  3. Related information such as STB TYPE and MAPPING will be loaded after selecting the desired MAC Address.
  4. Enter the amount of days that needs to get extended in the Days field.
  5. Enter remarks in the Remarks field.
  6. Click the ADD button.

docs.title: Add Bonus
docs.text:
Add Bonus is a functionality which is used when the customer has already made their Internet package payment but due to some system issues, the NETTV records didn't get updated resulting in NETTV Service disruption. In this case, customer don't need to pay for NETTV separately because the NETTV is included with the Internet Package itself. NEED TO REVIEW and MAKE AMMENDMENTS

Note

Bonus is provided as a free package with certain WorldLink Internet packages. Amount is billed to the WorldLink and not the end customer as WorldLink acts as a reseller of NETTV.

docs.title: How to Add Bonus?
docs.text:
To add bonus for eligible customers:

  1. Enter the Customer's username in the USERNAME field and select the respective username from the suggestions.
  2. Choose a respective MAC Address from Select MAC dropdown field.
  3. Related information such as Offer name, Stb and Offer duration will be loaded after selecting the desired MAC Address.
  4. Enter a valid internet invoice number in the Invoice field.
  5. Click the ADD button.

docs.title: Criteria for the Bonus Addition
docs.text:
• Number of Set top box (STB) defined in plan category are eligible. (Primary STB has higher priority)
  • Plan category ID should be mapped to NETTV offer.
  • Should have a valid internet invoice number.
  • Rental and refundable should be paid or adjusted.
  • STB should be associated with username on ebill as well as on NETTV end. In case of mismatch, bonus cannot be applied.
  • Nettv package is synced with the number of days of the internet days.

(reference: https://confluence.wlink.com.np/display/PROG/NETTV+Doc)

docs.title: Buy Package
docs.text: Buy Package is a functionality which is used to purchase the NETTV Package for the customer. NEED TO REVIEW and MAKE AMMENDMENTS

docs.title: How to Buy/Top Up Package?
docs.text:
To buy package for customers:

  1. Enter the Customer's username in the USERNAME field and select the respective username from the suggestions.
  2. Choose a respective STB MAC Address from STB.
  3. Related information such as STB TYPE, MAPPING and PACKAGE will be loaded after selecting the desired MAC Address.
  4. Select the appropriate NETTV Package from the PACKAGE dropdown menu.
  5. After selecting a package, a TOP AMOUNT field will load displaying the amount to be paid for the selected package.
  6. Click the ADD button.
  7. A prompt will appear asking for confirmation, click Continue to buy the package.

docs.title: Dashboard
docs.text:
After the successful login, users are redirected to the NETTV Dashboard's homepage called 'Dashboard'.

Fig. NETTV Dashboard

docs.title: NETTV Dashboard User Interface
docs.text:
1. Navigation Panel: On the left side of the screen, Navigation panel can be found. It can be used to access various pages within the web application.
  2. Dashboard: On the right side of the Navigation panel, various data tables & figures related to NETTV services are shown.
  3. Login information: On the top-right of the screen, username of the logged in user can be found. Users can log out of the NETTV Dashboard by clicking the username and Log Out option.
  4. Hide/Show Button: On the top-left of the screen, there is a toggle icon that the users can click to hide or show the Navigation panel.

docs.title: Dashboard facts & figures
docs.text:
Fig. Information section of the Dashboard

Here, users are provided with facts and figures related to the NETTV Services. In the above screenshot, following information can be seen:

  1. Total Users: On the blue box, total number of NETTV Users that are registered in WorldLink are displayed.

  2. Active Users: On the green box, total count of Active Users out of total number of NETTV Users are displayed.

docs.title: Login to NETTV Dashboard
docs.text: NETTV Dashboard can be accessed through a web browser via https://nettv.wlink.com.np. You will see a Login box asking for your WorldLink credentials.

docs.title: Prerequisities
docs.text:
• A valid WorldLink Exchange ID. (Exchange ID must have a valid email address.)
  • Exchange ID must exist in SMSCAST.
  • A valid NETTV Dashboard access. (Please contact your immediate supervisor if you need the access.)

docs.title: Offers
docs.text: Offers section provides informations regarding the NETTV offers along with their details and requirements.

docs.title: Offers User Interface
docs.text:
The user interface can be broken down into:

  1. Search: Currently the search is non-functional.
  2. NAME: Name of the NETTV Offer.
  3. DURATION: Duration of the respective offer.
  4. AMOUNT: Price of the Offer.
  5. STATUS: Shows whether the offer is Enabled or Disabled.
  6. CHARGE: Require means that the customer needs to pay the charged amount in order to get this offer, Skip means they do not need to pay.
  7. RENEWABLE: Shows whether the offer can be renewed or not after it's validity period ends.
  8. MULTIPLE INVOICE: ????????????????????

docs.title: NETTV Offer Map
docs.text: NETTV Offer Map section basically facilitates user to map NETTV offer to a single or multiple Internet Plan categories.

docs.title: How to map NETTV Offer?
docs.text:
To map a NETTV offer with an Internet Plan category:

  1. In the Enter plan category id, enter the Internet plan category that needs to be mapped with an offer.
  2. In the Enter offer name, enter the name of the NETTV offer with which the above Internet category shall be mapped.
  3. Click MAP button to Map the Plan with the Offer.

Note

You can map select multiple Internet categories to map with a NETTV offer.

docs.title: Offers Mapping
docs.text: Offer Mapping sections shows the Offers mapped with the Internet categories along with other details.

docs.title: Offers Mapping User Interface
docs.text:
The User Interface can be broken down into:

  1. Search: Search for Plan category through Plan category ID.
  2. PLAN CATEGORY ID: Shows the Id of the Internet Plan Category.
  3. PLAN NAME: Shows the name of the Plan Category.
  4. OFFER NAME: Shows the name of the NETTV Offer.
  5. OFFER DURATION: Shows the duration of the respective NETTV offer.
  6. SERVICES: Shows which service the offer provide.
  7. RENTAL CHARGE: Show the amount of Rental fee needed for the given offer.
  8. STATUS: Shows whether the offer is Enabled or Disabled.

docs.title: Reports
docs.text: Reports is where all the records of performed/executed activities reside.

docs.title: Action Log
docs.text: Action Log sections stores the logs of the Users(WorldLink Staff) that performed certain actions on a certain Username on a certain date.

docs.title: Action Log User Interface
docs.text:
The User Interface can be broken down into:

  1. Search: Search for Action through Customer Username.
  2. USERNAME: Displays the Username of the NETTV Customer.
  3. MAC ADDRESS: Displays the Device/STB MAC Address of the respective username.
  4. EXCHANGE USERNAME: Displays the exchange username of the WorldLink's staff who performed the action.
  5. ACTION DATE: Shows when the respective action was performed.
  6. ACTION: Shows the action that was executed. Actions can either be create or delete.

docs.title: Bonus List
docs.text:
Bonus List section displays the logs of the bonus given to the NETTV customers when they bought a certain Internet package that included a NETTV package as a bonus.

Note

Bonus is added automatically during the purchase of Internet package. If this doesnt happen, refer to Add Bonus page.

docs.title: Bonus List User Interface
docs.text:
The User Interface can be broken down into:

  1. Search: Search for Bonus added through Customer Username.
  2. USERNAME: Displays the Username of the NETTV Customer.
  3. MAC ADDRESS: Displays the Device/STB MAC Address of the respective username.
  4. OFFER NAME: Displays the name of the offer.
  5. INVOICE NUMBER: Displays the invoice number of the transaction when the customer paid their Internet bill.
  6. ADDED DATE: Displays the date and time of when the bonus was added.
  7. ADDED BY: Displays who added the bonus. If it's epayment.admin then it's an automated process which added the bonus automatically, if it's an exchange username of WorldLink staff then due to some issue, then respective staff added the bonus manually.

docs.title: Invoices
docs.text: Invoices section displays the logs of invoice information of the Customer.

docs.title: Invoices User Interface
docs.text:
The User Interface can be broken down into:

  1. Customer ID: Displays the Username of the NETTV Customer.
  2. Customer Name: Displays the Name of the customer.
  3. Fiscal Year/Invoice no.: Displays in which fiscal year the invoice was generated along with the Invoice number.
  4. Payment Gateway: Displays the gateway of the payment.
  5. Product Name: Displays which product the customer purchased.
  6. Taxable Amount: Displays the taxable amount.
  7. Vat Amount: Displays the VAT amount.
  8. Total Amount: Displays the Total amount the customer paid.
  9. Quantity/Unit: ?????????????
  10. Transaction Date: Displays the date and time of the transaction.
  11. Created by: Displays the creator of the invoice.
  12. Branch: Displays the branch office name of the creator.

  13. Actions: Displays action buttons that performs certain function. In this case we only have a Print invoice button which will open the invoice in a ready to print (.pdf) format.

    Tip

  14. Download Button: Downloads the invoices records from a selected date range in an Excel format.

    Tip

  15. Refresh Button: Refreshes the Invoices UI.

  16. Filter Button: Filters the Invoices records based on given criterias.

    Here, users can filter the invoices records with

    1. Username: Customer's Username.
    2. Created by: Creator of the Invoice.
    3. Branch: Certain WorldLink branches.
    4. From Date: A starting date.
    5. To Date: An ending date.

docs.title: How to Print an invoice?
docs.text:
1. Click the Print invoice at the end of the row of a desired Customer.
  2. A new tab with Invoice will open.
  3. Click the Print icon. (Depends upon the Internet Browser.)
  4. Click the Print button to begin printing the invoice.

docs.title: How to download invoices records?
docs.text:
1. Select a starting date in From Date.
  2. Select an ending date in To Date.
  3. Click Download button to export the records in an Excel format.

docs.title: Package Billing
docs.text: Package Billing section displays the logs of the billing of the NETTV packages. NEED TO REVIEW and MAKE AMMENDMENTS

docs.text:

docs.text:

docs.title: Replace List
docs.text:
Replace List section displays the list of the Set Top Box (STB) replacement from one device to another.

Note

Replacement not only replaces a damaged STB with a new one but also migrates any NETTV Customer with Old system into a new one.

docs.title: Replace List User Interface
docs.text:
The User Interface can be broken down into:

  1. Search: Search for Bonus added through Customer Username.
  2. USERNAME: Displays the Username of the NETTV Customer.
  3. OLD MAC ADDRESS: Displays the Device/STB MAC Address of the old Device/STB
  4. NEW MAC ADDRESS: Displays the Device/STB MAC Address of the new Device/STB.
  5. REPLACE DATE: Displays the date of the replacement made.
  6. REPLACE BY: Displays the name of the WorldLink Field Staff/Attendant (FA) who replaced the Device/STB.
  7. REASON: Displays the reason for which the replacement was made.

docs.title: Sync Package
docs.text: Sync Package is used to synchronize the NETTV Package with it's respective WorldLink Internet account.

docs.title: How to Sync Package with the Internet
docs.text:
To Sync package with the Internet:

  1. Enter the Customer's username in the USERNAME field and select the respective username from the suggestions.
  2. Click the SYNC button.
  3. A prompt will appear asking for confirmation, click Continue to sync the package. Easy!

docs.title: Create User
docs.text: Create User functionality is used to re-map an existing username which due to some issues, didn't update in the Retail User's database.

docs.title: How to create user?
docs.text:
To Create a User:

  1. Enter the Customer's username in the USERNAME field and select the respective username from the suggestions.
  2. Choose a respective MAC Address from Select MAC dropdown field.
  3. Click Create to create the user.

Warning

Even if a username already exists, users can still create a new user with that same username. This action will replace the existing user's package and its validity period. Before creating a new user, please make sure the username is not in the User List before proceeding.

docs.title: Skip Uninstallation
docs.text:
Skip Uninstallation functionality is used when the Set Top Box (STB) cannot be uninstalled physically due to the device being lost, damaged or other unforeseen circumstances. This makes sure that the uninstallation process will continue without having to uninstall the STB Device.

Note

When a customer uninstalls their Internet then they are uninstalling the NETTV services simultaneously.

docs.title: How to Skip Uninstallation?
docs.text:
To Skip Uninstallation for a customer:

  1. Enter the Customer's username in the USERNAME field and select the respective username from the suggestions.
  2. Choose a respective MAC Address from STB dropdown field.
  3. Enter remarks in the Remarks field.
  4. A prompt will appear asking for confirmation, click Continue to sync the package. Done!

docs.title: Migrate
docs.text:
Migrate functionality is used to migrate old NETTV system users onto the new system.

Note

There are currently 2 NETTV Systems operating: Old and a New System. Majority of the customer base have been moved to the new system but some are still running on the old system.

To migrate a customer from Old to New NETTV System:

  1. Enter the Customer's username in the USERNAME field and select the respective username from the suggestions.
  2. Choose a respective MAC Address from STB dropdown field.
  3. Related information such as STB TYPE and MAPPING will be loaded after selecting the desired MAC Address.
  4. Click the Migrate button.

docs.title: Users
docs.text:
Users page is where all the Retail NETTV subscriber's record reside. This page also acts as the first point of troubleshooting where the details of all the customers can be viewed. NEED TO REVIEW and MAKE AMMENDMENTS

Note

The NETTV Dashboard exclusively maintains records for Retail Customers only and it's functionalities are specifically tailored to address them. It's important to note that Corporate NETTV Customers receive dedicated support from the Corporate department.

docs.title: Users UI
docs.text:
Broken down in the screenshot above, the user interface contains a table with columns, buttons and a field through which Retail Users/Customer's information can be viewed and managed. NEED TO REVIEW and MAKE AMMENDMENTS

  1. ADD BONUS: Refer Add Bonus
  2. MIGRATE: Refer Migrate
  3. USERNAME: Displays the usernames that are subscribed to the NETTV service.
  4. MAC ADDRESS: Displays the Device/STB MAC Address of the respective username.
  5. CREATED DATE: Displays the date of the NETTV account created.
  6. ADDED BY: Displays the name of the WorldLink's staff who added the Customer's account.
  7. STATUS: Displays the Account Status of the respective username, whether the account is Active or Inactive.
  8. SEARCH: Users can search for customer's NETTV account information through their usernames or STB MAC Address using this search box.
  9. ACTION: Action Column contains three action buttons, each performing various tasks:

docs.title: Disable User
docs.text: Disables the respective customer from all the NETTV services. Make sure to provide a valid reason before disabling a customer. NEED TO REVIEW and MAKE AMMENDMENTS

docs.title: User Detail
docs.text:
User detail brings up a window with two tabs containing various informations.

Note

There are currently two NETTV Systems operating: Old and a New System. Majority of the customer base have been moved to the new system but some are still running on the old system.

The first tab, DETAIL(--- SYSTEM), displays the overall NETTV package information of the customer. NEED TO REVIEW and MAKE AMMENDMENTS

  1. PACKAGE NAME: Name of the NETTV package the customer is subscribed to.
  2. QUANTITY: Number of Days remaining in the customer's account.
  3. CREATED DATE
  4. EXPIRY DATE:
    • Channel: Expiry date of the NETTV. NEED TO REVIEW and MAKE AMMENDMENTS
    • App: Expiry date of the Mobile NETTV App. NEED TO REVIEW and MAKE AMMENDMENTS
  1. CREATED BY: Displays who created the account of the give NETTV Customer. It shows Staff's name if it was created by a WorldLink Staff, scripted if it was an automated creation or epayment.admin if it was created through an online payment procedure. NEED TO REVIEW and MAKE AMMENDMENTS
  2. STB: Shows if the device is either Primary or Secondary.

The second tab, BILLING HISTORY displays every transaction history of the respective customer.

docs.title: Delete User
docs.text: This button deletes the customer account from the NETTV system.

docs.title: Wallet Top Up
docs.text: Wallet Top Up is used to add Balance or Money into the customer's in-app wallet so that they can buy TV Channel packages and movies within the NETTV system.

docs.title: How to Top Up a Wallet?
docs.text:
1. Enter the Customer's username in the USERNAME field and select the respective username from the suggestions.
  2. Enter the Top Up amount (NRs.) in the Amount field.
  3. Click the SUBMIT button.
  4. A prompt will appear asking for confirmation, click Continue to confirm the Top Up. That's it!
